pullrequest.title: auto adjust the ruler-scale only if a rule-scale is not specified by the user

content.raw:
Should this be
```python
if res.resolution != RESOLUTION and 
not options.ruler_scale:
```
?

If ruler_scale is not set, then options.ruler_scale would on it's own would be false. This condition is supposed to check if the ruler_scale is not set and evaluate to true if so.

Another minor thing that doesn't matter too much either way is keeping each statement/conditional on seperate lines so it's easier to debug in the future if it needs to be stepped through. It's immediately obvious which condition is hit if each condition is on a seperate line.
